item.title: Etihad Airways now includes Melbourne as a destination for its A380 aircraft
item.description:
Etihad Airways has launched a new era of luxury air travel between Melbourne and Abu Dhabi with the introduction of the A380 superjumbo. This flagship aircraft, which features luxurious amenities like The Residence and next-generation cabins, will operate on one of the airline’s two daily flights between the cities, replacing a three-class Boeing 777-300ER. Passengers can enjoy innovative hospitality services during their flight, including a dedicated Butler, Inflight Chef, Flying Nanny, and Food and Beverage Managers...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/etihad-airways-now-includes-melbourne-as-a-destination-for-its-a380-aircraft/

item.title: Etihad introduces A380 flights connecting Abu Dhabi and Mumbai
item.description:
Etihad Airways, the national airline of the UAE, will begin operating its Airbus A380 aircraft between Abu Dhabi and Mumbai starting May 1, 2016. This comes after the successful introduction of the A380 on routes to Sydney and, beginning in June 2016, Melbourne. The airline’s 496-seat A380, based in Abu Dhabi, offers 50% more seating capacity than the Boeing B777-300ER it is replacing. This allows Etihad to provide more travel options and boost tourism between India, the US, and Abu Dhabi...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/etihad-introduces-a380-flights-connecting-abu-dhabi-and-mumbai/

item.title: Etihad transforms new aircraft into a luxurious boutique hotel experience in the sky
item.description:
Etihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, has completely redesigned the future of air travel for first, business, and economy classes. These new designs will be featured on their Airbus A380 and Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft, which are expected to be delivered later this year. Five years in development, the airline’s design goal was to bring the personalized and exclusive experience of a luxury boutique hotel to air travel...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/etihad-transforms-new-aircraft-into-a-luxurious-boutique-hotel-experience-in-the-sky/

item.title: Etihad announces first destinations for Airbus A380 and Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft
item.description:
Etihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, has announced the initial destinations for its new Airbus A380 and Boeing 787 Dreamliner aircraft. Source: Etihad. The Boeing 787-9. The Abu Dhabi-based airline will start flying its first A380 to London’s Heathrow Airport in December 2014, with a second A380 added to the same route in the first quarter of 2015. By the end of 2015, Etihad Airways will have five A380s in service, with plans to also introduce them on routes to Sydney and New York’s JFK Airport...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/etihad-announces-first-destinations-for-airbus-a380-and-boeing-787-dreamliner-aircraft/

item.title: Emirates introduces Airbus A380 to Perth route
item.description:
Starting May 1, 2015, Emirates will introduce its Airbus A380 aircraft to the Perth, Australia route. This upgrade from a Boeing 777-300ER on one of the three daily Dubai-Perth flights signifies Perth’s growth as a global destination. This change will increase capacity by 136 seats per flight and 1,904 seats weekly, highlighting Emirates’ dedication to travelers visiting Western Australia’s capital city. Barry Brown, Emiratesâ€™ Divisional Senior Vice President, Commercial Operations - East, emphasized the importance of Australia as a destination by highlighting this fifth Emirates A380 service in partnership with Qantas...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/emirates-introduces-airbus-a380-to-perth-route/

item.title: Etihad plans to increase the number of flights between Abu Dhabi and Melbourne
item.description:
Etihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, will begin offering daily A380 flights between Abu Dhabi and Melbourne starting June 1, 2016. This will affect flight numbers EY460/461, one of the airline’s two daily trips between the cities. This change replaces one of the three-class Boeing 777-300ER aircraft currently used. Passengers can now enjoy The Residence by Etihad, a luxurious private three-room suite, and other cutting-edge products and services across all cabins...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/etihad-plans-to-increase-the-number-of-flights-between-abu-dhabi-and-melbourne/
